name: Low Fat Lemon Lima Bean Tabbouleh
author: Menealeous' Daughter
summary: Lemon, ginger, and garlic infuse this salad with so much flavor, you don't miss the extra oil or cheese. Lima beans add some extra color, not to mention fiber and protein! I have substituted quinoa for the bulgur to great success (prepare according to package directions). Make sure to allow enough time to make ahead and let all the flavors marry in the fridge before serving.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon peeled and grated fresh ginger root
1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste
1 cup peeled, seeded, and chopped cucumber
¼ cup thinly sliced green onion
⅓ cup finely chopped fresh mint
directions: Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, ginger, garlic, sugar, and coriander together in a bowl
Combine water, bulgur, and salt in a saucepan; bring to a boil
Cover saucepan, reduce heat, and simmer until water is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes
Remove from heat and fluff with a fork
Bring a separate saucepan of water to a boil; add lima beans and garlic salt
Cook until lima beans are tender, 5 to 7 minutes; drain
Mix bulgur, lima beans, tomato, cucumber, green onion, and mint together in a large bowl; drizzle dressing over bulgur mixture
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate to blend flavors, 2 hours to overnight
